timeline.bodyText: This change is curious. The setInfluxDatabase method accepts null, so this value should also be nullable. Should you change the setter as well? Or is there something else going on?
timeline.author: kennknowles

replies.bodyText:
I removed those nullable as it was expecting these fields non-null here via, this. I removed the Nullable from here thinking of it as a test code and InfluxDBSettings.java as a non-test code.
Annotating the corresponding fields at InfluxDBSettings.java as Nullable also should work.
Should I go with that?
replies.author: jayendra13

replies.bodyText: Ah that makes sense. What you should do, I think, is alter setInfluxDatabase so the parameter is non-nullable. Otherwise somehow the pipeline options would be magically turning null into non-null.
replies.author: kennknowles

replies.bodyText: So these three getters (for measurements, host and database) are fine, and we should also change these three setters to take non-null arguments. Correct me if I am wrong.
replies.author: jayendra13

replies.bodyText: Yes, exactly. I wonder if we can alter the core PipelineOptions code that generates the proxy objects to ensure that the nullability matches... (if you want an extra fun follow up project...)
replies.author: kennknowles
